Participants.evidence: 344 patients who had AVM resections at the University of California, San Francisco (1997–2007)

Intervention.evidence: 21 RS + patients were matched with 21 RS − patients

Objective.evidence: To better characterize these effects, we compared results of microsurgical resection of radiated (RS + ) and non-radiated (RS − ) AVMs

Method_Outcome.evidence: outcomes, which were assessed with the modified Rankin Scale (mRS)

Number_Randomised.evidence: 21 RS + patients were matched with 21 RS − patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean AVM volume was reduced by 78% (P<0.01)

Harms.evidence: RS + patients deteriorated between AVM diagnosis and surgery due to hemorrhages during the latency period (P< 0.05)
